page.title: 06Sibton Park Cricket Club
page.content: In 1963 Sibton Park Cricket Club was founded. My Dad (B E Woodhams) used to be Vice Chairman of the Cricket Club, but he does not play cricket any more. Mark's father D Rawlings still plays though. During the iwnter of 1969 the pitch was flooded and was then used as an ice-skating rink until it all melted. There is now a bar in the new pavillion, called the Wet Wicket, and when Mark and I sometimes watch the match we buy a few drinks there. The new pavillion was officially opened by the Archbishop of Canterbury, Dr Robert Runcie in 1981. The Club has a very nice pitch and coversw at least half a square mile. On one side of the pitch they have got a practising stretch for the junior members of the Cricket Club.
